issue.title: Minimizing the app while on enter identity dialog (in Identify user form) closes the form
issue.body:
#### ODK Collect version
the store version 2023.3 Beta 1, 2023.2.4
#### Android version
10, 13
#### Device used
Redmi 9T, Pixel 6a
#### Problem description
Minimizing the app while on enter identity dialog (in Identify user form) closes the form without any save point and "reopens/ doubles" the app/main menu
#### Steps to reproduce the problem
1. Go to Identifity user form.
[identify-user-audit.xml.txt](https://github.com/getodk/collect/files/13186755/identify-user-audit.xml.txt)
2.  While on "Enter identity” dialog, minimize the app, go to a different app and go back.
3. The user is moved to the main menu, click the device back button - the main menu is "opened/loaded” once again.

If steps 1-2 are repeated 4 times, the user needs to click back button 4 times to leave the app (4 times main menu loads).
#### Expected behavior
The form shouldn’t close after minimizing

comment.body: Yes but I also added the "reopening" of the app in this issue

issue.title: As of July 31, 2023, Stamen Map Tiles are served by Stadia Maps
issue.body:
#### Problem description
As of July 31, 2023, Stamen Map Tiles are served by Stadia Maps. Learn more here: https://maps.stamen.com/stadia-partnership/
It seems that this will no longer be free:

```
Once you have signed up for an account with Stadia, your cost is based on tile usage, meaning how many map tiles are requested through your app or website.

- If your current usage is less than 200,000 tiles / month—FREE for non-commercial use
- If your usage goes above 200,000 tiles / month or you are a commercial user—plans start at $20/month. The full pricing is [here](https://stadiamaps.com/pricing/).
```

so probably we will need to get rid of this provider.

forkee.name: collect
forkee.description: ODK Collect is an Android app for filling out forms. It's been used to collect billions of data points in challenging environments around the world. Contribute and make the world a better place! ✨📋✨

issue.title: Selfie widget doesn't change to landscape view
issue.body:
#### ODK Collect version
the store version 2023.3 Beta 1, 2023.2.4
#### Android version
10, 13
#### Device used
Redmi 9T, Pixel 6a
#### Problem description
In Selfie widget the camera doesn’t change to landscape view after rotation. The taken photo is in the portrait view.
#### Steps to reproduce the problem
1. Open All widgets form and go to Selfie widget.
2. Tap "Take a picture”.
3. Rotate the device so that it’s in the landscape view.
4. Take a photo.
#### Expected behavior
The camera should take photos in the landscape view.

comment.body: We might mark this as "won't fix" as we're not sure we need to support landscape selfies

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -213,6 +213,8 @@ public void onItemClick(AdapterView<?> parent, View view, int position, long id)
                             c.getString(c.getColumnIndex(DatabaseInstanceColumns.CAN_EDIT_WHEN_COMPLETE));
 
                     boolean canEdit = status.equals(Instance.STATUS_INCOMPLETE)
+                            || status.equals(Instance.STATUS_INVALID)
comment.body: Ah sorry I should have put that together. So I guess instead of adding the new statuses we could just remove the check on `canEdit` (and the logic to assign it) right? It seems like it isn't currently needed.

pull_request.title: Improvements around new statuses used by drafts in v2023.3
pull_request.body:
This pr does not fix anything important but adds some improvements that should be included in v2023.3. I've investigated the places in the app where draft statuses are used and did not discover anything apart from: https://github.com/getodk/collect/issues/5798 so this pr with improvements should be the last fix

#### Why is this the best possible solution? Were any other approaches considered?
The only thing of note is the fix for opening editable instances: https://github.com/getodk/collect/commit/43071e0140e4ad266d1fca398d6b058713e4d817
It worked well but only because of the fact that `strCanEditWhenComplete` is always true for drafts. In the future, if we remove it we could introduce regression easily.

#### How does this change affect users? Describe intentional changes to behavior and behavior that could have accidentally been affected by code changes. In other words, what are the regression risks?
It doesn't require testing.

#### Do we need any specific form for testing your changes? If so, please attach one.
No.

#### Does this change require updates to documentation? If so, please file an issue [here]( https://github.com/getodk/docs/issues/new) and include the link below.
No.

#### Before submitting this PR, please make sure you have:
- [x] added or modified tests for any new or changed behavior
- [x] run `./gradlew checkAll` and confirmed all checks still pass OR confirm CircleCI build passes and run `./gradlew connectedDebugAndroidTest` locally.
- [x] added a comment above any new strings describing it for translators
- [x] verified that any code or assets from external sources are properly credited in comments and/or in the [about file](https://github.com/getodk/collect/blob/master/collect_app/src/main/assets/open_source_licenses.html).
- [x] verified that any new UI elements use theme colors. [UI Components Style guidelines](https://github.com/getodk/collect/blob/master/docs/CODE-GUIDELINES.md#ui-components-style-guidelines)

@@ -213,6 +213,8 @@ public void onItemClick(AdapterView<?> parent, View view, int position, long id)
                             c.getString(c.getColumnIndex(DatabaseInstanceColumns.CAN_EDIT_WHEN_COMPLETE));
 
                     boolean canEdit = status.equals(Instance.STATUS_INCOMPLETE)
+                            || status.equals(Instance.STATUS_INVALID)
comment.body:
As in the description: 

The only thing of note is the fix for opening editable instances: https://github.com/getodk/collect/commit/43071e0140e4ad266d1fca398d6b058713e4d817
It worked well but only because of the fact that `strCanEditWhenComplete` is always true for drafts. In the future, if we remove it we could introduce regression easily.

So it works well but only because of that `strCanEditWhenComplete`.

#### Does this change require updates to documentation? If so, please file an issue [here]( https://github.com/getodk/docs/issues/new) and include the link below.
No.

- [x] run `./gradlew checkAll` and confirmed all checks still pass OR confirm CircleCI build passes and run `./gradlew connectedDebugAndroidTest` locally.

pull_request.title: Improvements around new statuses used by drafts in v2023.3
pull_request.body:
This pr does not fix anything important but adds some improvements that should be included in v2023.3. I've investigated the places in the app where draft statuses are used and did not discover anything apart from: https://github.com/getodk/collect/issues/5798 so this pr with improvements should be the last fix

#### Why is this the best possible solution? Were any other approaches considered?
The only thing of note is the fix for opening editable instances: https://github.com/getodk/collect/commit/43071e0140e4ad266d1fca398d6b058713e4d817
It worked well but only because of the fact that `strCanEditWhenComplete` is always true for drafts. In the future, if we remove it we could introduce regression easily.

#### How does this change affect users? Describe intentional changes to behavior and behavior that could have accidentally been affected by code changes. In other words, what are the regression risks?
It doesn't require testing.

#### Do we need any specific form for testing your changes? If so, please attach one.
No.

#### Does this change require updates to documentation? If so, please file an issue [here]( https://github.com/getodk/docs/issues/new) and include the link below.
No.

#### Before submitting this PR, please make sure you have:
- [x] added or modified tests for any new or changed behavior
- [x] run `./gradlew checkAll` and confirmed all checks still pass OR confirm CircleCI build passes and run `./gradlew connectedDebugAndroidTest` locally.
- [x] added a comment above any new strings describing it for translators
- [x] verified that any code or assets from external sources are properly credited in comments and/or in the [about file](https://github.com/getodk/collect/blob/master/collect_app/src/main/assets/open_source_licenses.html).
- [x] verified that any new UI elements use theme colors. [UI Components Style guidelines](https://github.com/getodk/collect/blob/master/docs/CODE-GUIDELINES.md#ui-components-style-guidelines)

issue.title: Selfie widget doesn't change to landscape view
issue.body:
#### ODK Collect version
the store version 2023.3 Beta 1, 2023.2.4
#### Android version
10, 13
#### Device used
Redmi 9T, Pixel 6a
#### Problem description
In Selfie widget the camera doesn’t change to landscape view after rotation. The taken photo is in the portrait view.
#### Steps to reproduce the problem
1. Open All widgets form and go to Selfie widget.
2. Tap "Take a picture”.
3. Rotate the device so that it’s in the landscape view.
4. Take a photo.
#### Expected behavior
The camera should take photos in the landscape view.

release.name: v2023.3-beta.1
release.body:
## What's Changed
* Block closing the notification permission dialog by tapping outside the bounds by @grzesiek2010 in https://github.com/getodk/collect/pull/5792
* Fixed searching in the list of drafts by @grzesiek2010 in https://github.com/getodk/collect/pull/5797
* Do not allow to delete projects with drafts no matter what their status is by @grzesiek2010 in https://github.com/getodk/collect/pull/5799
* Migrate old finalize key correctly by @seadowg in https://github.com/getodk/collect/pull/5795
* Mark forms as failed to send before sending by @grzesiek2010 in https://github.com/getodk/collect/pull/5794

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/getodk/collect/compare/v2023.3-beta.0...v2023.3-beta.1
release.short_description_html:
What's Changed

  • Block closing the notification permission dialog by tapping outside the bounds by @grzesiek2010 in #5792
  • Fixed searching in the list of drafts by @grzesiek2010 in #5797
  • Do not allow…

issue.title: Include "finalize all drafts" setting in migration of old "mark form as finalized"
issue.body:
From @dbemke in https://github.com/getodk/collect/pull/5776#issuecomment-1772620550

Old QR codes may have the old "mark form as finalized" admin setting. That setting was migrated to show/hide finalize and save as draft buttons on the form end screen. Now the finalize setting was migrated again so that introducing the "finalize all drafts" setting doesn't add a path to finalize for existing configurations. We should migrate the original "mark form as finalized" admin setting to match that.

issue.title: Issue 5687 "Possible to edit a form while it is being sent" reintroduced
issue.body:
#### ODK Collect version
the store version 2023.3 Beta 0
#### Android version
10, 13
#### Device used
Redmi 9T, Pixel 6a
#### Problem description
The issue was fixed in PR #5688 but it's still present in v2023.3 Beta 0
It’s possible to edit a form while it is being sent. It’s possible to reproduce it with small forms by going to the form (being sent) via snackbar or by adding a bigger file to a form (so sending takes more time) and going to the form in Ready to send.
#### Steps to reproduce the problem
1. Auto send settings on (e.g. wifi only with wifi on, Wifi or cellular with both on).
2. Go to All widgets form.
3. In Image widget add a big-sized image. (the image in the link)
https://drive.google.com/drive/u/0/folders/1IeuxQZU8Sw90PAOnTRlMToB3Wp_LuCoN
4. Go to end and Send the form.
5. In the snackbar click View. 

#### Expected behavior
Forms that are being sent shouldn’t be editable.
#### Other information
The issue doesn't occur in the store verison 2023.2.4

commits.message: Revert 'Do not mark forms as failed to send before sending' in v2023.3

Merge pull request #5794 from grzesiek2010/COLLECT-5790

Revert 'Do not mark forms as failed to send before sending' in v2023.3
